columns.name: cluster_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_name
columns.description: A user-generated string that you use to identify your cluster.

columns.name: active_services_count
columns.description: The number of services that are running on the cluster in an ACTIVE state.

columns.name: pending_tasks_count
columns.description: The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the PENDING state.

columns.name: registered_container_instances_count
columns.description: The number of container instances registered into the cluster. This includes container instances in both ACTIVE and DRAINING status.

columns.name: running_tasks_count
columns.description: The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the RUNNING state.

columns.name: attachments_status
columns.description: The status of the capacity providers associated with the cluster.

columns.name: attachments
columns.description: The resources attached to a cluster. When using a capacity provider with a cluster, the Auto Scaling plan that is created will be returned as a cluster attachment.

columns.name: capacity_providers
columns.description: The capacity providers associated with the cluster.

columns.name: default_capacity_provider_strategy
columns.description: The default capacity provider strategy for the cluster.

columns.name: settings
columns.description: The settings for the cluster. This parameter indicates whether CloudWatch Container Insights is enabled or disabled for a cluster.

columns.name: statistics
columns.description: Additional information about your clusters that are separated by launch type.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags attached to the cluster.
